abstract: Exxon Mobil’s $31 billion deal to buy XTO Energy is the latest and most significant signal that large companies are moving to make major investments in shale fields in the United States.
snippet: Exxon Mobil’s $31 billion deal to buy XTO Energy is the latest and most significant signal that large companies are moving to make major investments in shale fields in the United States.
lead_paragraph: Over the last decade, a handful of the nation’s small energy companies pulled off a coup. Right under the noses of the industry’s biggest players, they discovered huge amounts of natural gas in fields stretching from Texas to Pennsylvania.

headline.main: In Exxon Deal, Signs of the New Gusher
